member.name: KDHELP
member.summary: Information that is used by kernel debuggers to trace through user-mode callbacks in a thread's kernel stack.

member.name: KDHELP.Thread
member.summary: The address of the kernel thread object, as provided in the WAIT_STATE_CHANGE packet.

member.name: KDHELP.ThCallbackStack
member.summary: The offset in the thread object to the pointer to the current callback frame in the kernel stack.

member.name: KDHELP.NextCallback
member.summary: The address of the next callback frame.

member.name: KDHELP.FramePointer
member.summary: The address of the saved frame pointer, if applicable.

member.name: KDHELP.KiCallUserMode
member.summary: The address of the kernel function that calls out to user mode.

member.name: KDHELP.KeUserCallbackDispatcher
member.summary: The address of the user-mode dispatcher function.

member.name: KDHELP.SystemRangeStart
member.summary: The lowest kernel-mode address.

member.name: KDHELP.ThCallbackBStore
member.summary: Intel Itanium: The offset in the thread object to a pointer to the current callback backing store frame in the kernel stack.

summary.para: The address of the user-mode exception dispatcher function.
DbgHelp 6.1 and earlier: This member is not supported.

member.name: KDHELP.StackBase
member.summary: The address of the stack base.

member.name: KDHELP.StackLimit
member.summary: The stack limit.

member.name: KDHELP.Reserved
member.summary: This member is reserved for use by the operating system.
